III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4505 Plans and specifications.
Section (1) Plans and specifications shall be submitted to the bureau of fire
Description services for review and approval prior to any remodeling in an
institution, or the construction or conversion of a structure for use
as an institution.
1

Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation The facility erected walls around the staff desks on the living units.
A search of BFS plans did not find any plans submitted for this
remodel which is required by Rule 505 Plans and specifications.
Investigation Interviews
Department of Child Welfare Licensing Area Manager searched
Accela on 08/15/2025 for the project number and status of Wayne
County Juvenile Detention’s remodeling of Unit 3B’s staff desk
area. A project number was not found.
Residential Director provided the following timeline for the
remodeling of Unit 3B’s staff desk area.
• 06/02/2025 Unit 3B youths transfer to another unit.
• 06/23/2025 Unit 3B staff desk remodeling project begins.
• 07/03/2025 Unit 3B staff desk remodeling project is
completed.
• 08/18/2025 Unit 3B is reopened with staff and youths on
the unit.
Residential Director was given instructions on 08/22/2025 to
submit plans to bureau of fire services through Accela for Unit
3B’s remodeled staff desk area and other prospective remodeling
projects.
Tour
Unit 3B staff desk area was an open rectangular area with a staff
desk counter facing the unit gym and a parallel counter with
bottom cabinet storage behind the staff desk counter. The
remodeling project enclosed this staff desk area. At each end of
the staff desk area is a door that locks by key. The staff desk area
from counter height and up is constructed of a clear material
sectioned and framed by vertical metal rods. The top portion of the
staff desk area to the ceiling is constructed with a material like a
wire fence that allows for air flow and sound.
Analysis The agency is found in noncompliance for not submitting plans to
the bureau of fire services for review and approval prior to the
remodeling of Unit 3B’s staff desk area.
Conclusion VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
2

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules.
